title: Social class and context Tres Riches Heures

content.question:
Both images shown are from the illuminated manuscript known as the Très Riches Heures du Duc de Berry.

Compare and contrast the two images to analyze how social class is portrayed and how this portrayal relates to the meaning of the manuscript as a whole.

frqParts.text:
Both images shown are from the illuminated manuscript known as the Très Riches Heures du Duc de Berry.

Compare and contrast the two images to analyze how social class is portrayed and how this portrayal relates to the meaning of the manuscript as a whole.

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.1: Cultural Contexts of Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe contextual elements of a work of art (or group of related works of art), including-  a. function.  b. context.  c. siting or physical context.  d. subject matter.  e. reception.
